channel.title: Musics on Mícheál Keating / Archive
channel.description: Recent content in Musics on Mícheál Keating / Archive

item.title: LIVE LANDSCAPES / TÍRDHREACHA BEO
item.description: Music Album, 69mins and Photobook, 113 pages (2025) Hear/Purchase on Bandcamp An album of improvised performances recorded in various outdoor locations across rural County Limerick between 2023-2025. Captured using a pair of LOM basicUchos into a Zoom F3. No direct signal or overdubs were recorded. This album is part of the multimedia project ‘Live Landscapes’ and comes with an 108-page book of 120mm County Limerick landscape photography produced in collaboration with designer Hugh Heffernan.

item.title: Laura Duff - Sea Legs
item.description: Production, Mix, Guitar, Piano, Synth, Violin Hear it on Bandcamp Debut LP by Limerick singer-songwriter Laura Duff. Keating play’s guitar in Laura’s band, as well as handling recording/production/mixing.

item.title: Peist - Five
item.description: Improviser (vocals, guitar and signal processing) Hear it on Bandcamp The fifth album by improvised music collective Péist “Péist (transl. worm) are a group of musicians and artists based in Limerick. In their improvisations, they wriggle and writhe between sounds and musical forms, burrowing through the dirt. Peíst are Mícheál Keating, Daithí Mac Cruitín, Eilis Mahon, Cian McGuirk, Caimin Walsh and Aoibhinn O’Dea”

item.title: House of Changes
item.description: Director, Vocal, Guitar and Electronics Improvisation, Event Organiser ‘House of Changes’ was a 5 hour durational group improvisation event that took place in Ormston House on October 24th, 2024. Featured artists were Mícheál Keating, Caimin Walsh, Róis, Daithi MacCruithin, Eilis Mahon, Cian McGuirk, Méabh McKenna, Eimear Reidy and Cathal Roche. Media coverage from The Thin Air magazine below: “Tonight, Thursday 24 October 2024, from 6 to 11 pm, Ormston House in Limerick will host a remarkable event that promises to be a highlight of the Irish music calendar this year.

item.title: The Low Field - The Low Field
item.description: Production, Mix, Bass Guitar, Additonal Instrumentation Hear it on Bandcamp Debut LP by Limerick post-rock band The Low Field. Keating plays bass in the band, as well as handling recording/production/mixing.

item.title: Amanda Feery - we could be diving for pearls
item.description: Member of Vocal Ensemble, Vocal Improvisation Musical Composition for Vocal Ensemble and Electronics ‘we could be diving for pearls’ is a piece for vocal ensemble and electronics by composer Amanda Feery with text by Declan Synnott, commissioned by Gleo Festival, Limerick, November 2023. Keating was part of the vocal ensemble that interpreted and performed the improvisatory score, with Amanda Feery, Katie Fitzpatrick and Aoife Ní Raghallaigh.

item.title: Mícheál Keating - Out of Place OST
item.description: Composition, Production, Mix, Guitar, Bass, Synth, Drum Programming, Violin, Accordion Hear it on Bandcamp Original Score for Féile na Gréine’s documentary film ‘Out of Place’ “This is a pinhole view capturing a passing moment. The story is neither polished or neat, it is rough and taped together at the seams, fragmented and utterly incomplete. Featuring performances from Denise Chaila, God Knows, Hey Rusty, His Father’s Voice, MuRli, and Post Punk Podge & the Technohippies, OUT OF PLACE is an intimate portrayal of a local music scene, capturing the incredible diversity of cultural activity happening in Limerick City.

item.title: Mícheál Keating & Brendan McInerney - It's Still There
item.description: Composition, Production, Mix, Tape Loops, Vocals, Guitars, Bass, Synthesizers, Electronics, Viola, Flute. Hear it on Bandcamp ‘It’s Still There’ is a 10 minute instrumental piece by Mícheál Keating and drummer Brendan McInerney of Bleeding Heart Pigeons, commissioned by The Source Arts Centre, Thurles. The track marries elements of Progressive Rock, Drum-and-Bass, Electronic, Free Jazz, and Ambient music. The piece fixates on hauntings as virtual (non)presences, which can have persistent agency from a distant time or place.

item.title: SORBET - Born Purple
item.description: Songwriting, Lead Vocals, Additional Instrumentation Hear it on Bandcamp Collaborative track with Chris Ryan (Robocobra Quartet) which appeared on the album ‘This Was Paradise’ by his project SORBET. The album deals with themes of ecological breakdown and also features contributions from Maija Sofia, Arborist and others. Keating wrote lyrics for the song which were inspired by an experience of watching a cow die from milk fever.

item.title: Bleeding Heart Pigeons - Stir
item.description: Songwriting, Production, Vocals, Guitar, Electronics Hear it on Bandcamp The second full-length album by the Limerick art-rock band Bleeding Heart Pigeons, containing a collection of introspective and sonically adventurous pop songs. Keating’s roles in the project were lead songwriter/composer, lead vocalist, guitarist, electronics, engineer and producer. The album was written and recorded while working with Virgin Records, and was self-released independently in 2020 after leaving the label. Press coverage of ‘Stir’:

item.title: Un Separate
item.description: Composition Musical Score for Network-Connected Guitar Ensemble ‘Un Separate’ is a musical concept sketch for an improvisational electric guitar ensemble scattered throughout Limerick city centre. The piece was conceived during lockdown in April 2020 while trying to imagine ways which Limerick could experience live music once again, in a time where concerts have become an impossibility. Performers are located in various venues throughout the city centre, and though they are far apart and cannot hear each other, the improvisational structures they perform within are synchronised by timed visual cues to be delivered to each performer’s phone or personal device via network.

item.title: Bleeding Heart Pigeons - Real Connection/Weddings & Wakes
item.description: Songwriting, Production, Mix (track 2), Vocals, Guitar, Electronics Hear it on Bandcamp EP by Limerick art-rock band Bleeding Heart Pigeons

item.title: Soda Blonde - Swimming Through the Night (mickykiiatein Remix)
Bleeding Heart Pigeons - Is
item.description: Songwriting, Production, Vocals, Guitar, Electronics, Album Art Hear it on Spotify The debut album by art-rock band Bleeding Heart Pigeons, a 75-minute collection of songs based on existential themes. Keating’s roles in the project were lead songwriter/composer, lead vocalist, guitarist, engineer and producer. Released on Virgin Records UK, it was distributed worldwide, and led to the band supporting The Pixies, Beach House, Father John Misty, Villagers, Andrew Bird and others.

item.description: Songwriting, Production, Mix, Vocals, Guitar, Electronics, Album Art Hear it on Spotify Debut release by Limerick art-rock band Bleeding Heart Pigeons. Made when they were teenagers.
